intro: Nototriche foetida, commonly known as the stinking mint, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of pale blue or purple flowers. It is known for its strong, unpleasant odor, which is particularly noticeable when the leaves are crushed. Nototriche foetida is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
